node.statement: PART (a) â€” POLE MATCHING. As z -> nu_k (a root of r), nG_r(z) has a simple pole with residue 1, since nG_r(z) = sum_{i=1}^n 1/(z - nu_i). By the subordination identity G_r(z) = G_p(omega_1(z)), we have nG_p(omega_1(z)) = nG_r(z) -> infinity as z -> nu_k. Since nG_p(w) = sum_{j=1}^n 1/(w - lambda_j) diverges only when w -> lambda_j for some j, we must have omega_1(nu_k) = lambda_j for some j in {1,...,n}. Define sigma(k) := j. Similarly, from G_r(z) = G_q(omega_2(z)), define tau(k) by omega_2(nu_k) = mu_{tau(k)}.
